intro: Leptodermis virgata, commonly known as the slender skin vine, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus, and is characterized by its soft, hairy stems and alternate leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink, followed by capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is occasionally cultivated in horticultural settings.
